results.title: Yaaba
results.creator_credit: Idrissa Ouedraogo, Michel David, Freddy Denaes, Pierre-Alain Meier, Arcadia Films, Les Films de L'Avenir and Heima Film
results.brief_description: Few films are as fresh and simple as “Yaaba”, even fewer come as close to perfection. Set in a few flat, sunbaked hectares around a village in Burkina Faso the story is told with the directness of fable with little dialogue, and with the four-square photography confined to three colours - brown, blue and green. The central generation gap story is enriched with incidents of village life so that a vast range of human behaviour and experience is packed in without any sense of haste or padding. The result is not an example of naive cinema but a film whose technical and aesthetic sophistication is presented with an uncloying charm.

results.title: Ziegfeld Follies
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In a brief introductory passage, the now-dead showman, Ziegfield (William Powell), reminisces over his past triumphs (very well depicted with puppets). He then plans, from Heaven, a new “Follies”. The elaborate acts of his vision follow, with Fred Astaire, Lucille Bremer, Lucille Ball, Lena Horne, Gene Kelly, Esther Williams, Judy Garland and Kathryn Grayson. Interspersed are three good comedy routines featuring Victor Moore, Ed Arnold, Fanny Brice, Hume Cronin and Red Skelton.

results.title: Santa Claus: the movie
results.creator_credit: Jeannot Szwarc, Ilya Salkind, Alexander Salkind and Alexander Salkind Productions
results.brief_description: A live action film about Santa Claus, his elves and how one nasty rich man attempts to stop Christmas. The elves leave the Arctic to join Santa’s fight to bring back Christmas to all the children of the world. With Dudley Moore and John Lithgow.

results.title: Pal Joey
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Fred Kohlmar, George Sidney Productions and Essex
results.brief_description: Pal Joey, starring Frank Sinatra, Kim Novak and Rita Hayworth, is strong, funny entertainment based on a novel by John O’Hara. It features 14 songs from Rodgers and Hart including “The Lady is a Tramp”, “Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered” and “My Funny Valentine”. Sinatra is an out of heel nightclub singer, Joey Evans, who plays the field with women. He is ideal as the irreverent, glib Joey.

results.title: The Picture Show Man
results.creator_credit: John Power, Joan Long and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: Maurice Pym is a travelling cinema operator in the 1920’s who, with his son Larry and his dapper pianist Freddie, covers the back roads of northern New South Wales. The film follows their adventures and their rivalry with a brash American rival who intrudes into their territory and threatens to steal their livelihood. Based on the memoirs of Lyle Penn, the film nostalgically depicts a past age, and the effect of new technologies on the cinema industry. Cast includes Rod Taylor, John Meillon and Jeanie Drynan.

results.title: The Purple rose of Cairo
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Charles H. Joffe and Jack Rollins
results.brief_description: Trapped in a dreary marriage, Cecilia escapes to the cinema and in particular to the romantic adventure “The purple rose of Cairo”. Then one night as she watches the film the hero, Tom Baxter, steps out of the screen and into her life. But where does that leave the other characters - indeed the whole film? The real-life actor who played Tom is in danger of his career being finished, the producers see only lawsuits coming their way. Pandemonium sets in as real life clashes with fantasy. A bitter-sweet comedy starring Mia Farrow, Jeff Daniels and Danny Aiello. Best film 1985 British Academy Awards.

results.title: Flight of the doves
results.brief_description: Constantly bullied by their cruel stepfather, Finn Dove and his young sister Derval decide to run away and find their grandmother in Ireland. They are chased by their wicked Uncle Hawk, a master of disguise, who is aware that the children are heirs to a fortune. Features Ron Moody, Jack Wild and Helen Rayne. Based on the book by Walter Macken.

results.title: Blade runner
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Michael Deeley, Bud Yorkin, Jerry Perenchio, Sir Run Run Shaw and Ladd Company
results.brief_description: Ridley Scott’s adaptation of Philip K. Dick’s novel “Do androids dream of electric sheep” has rapidly become a classic of the science fiction genre. In Los Angeles, 2019, Deckard, a licensed-to-kill cop is given the task of tracking down and destroying a group of intelligent androids who have hijacked a space shuttle and returned to earth. In the process Deckard has to confront disturbing questions about what makes a human being. “A richly detailed and visually overwhelming trip to the future which sticks with you like a recurrent nightmare.” Stars Harrison Ford, Rutger Hauer and Sean Young.

results.title: The Unbearable lightness of being
results.creator_credit: Philip Kaufman, Saul Zaentz and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Tomas is a master of seduction. To him women are for pleasure and Sabina is the ultimate, a free spirit like himself. Life is blissfully simple until Tomas meets the young and innocent Tereza who awakens in him a tenderness he never knew possible. But it is 1968 and as the Russian tanks roll into Prague Tomas is forced to make choices; between love of his country and his yearning for freedom, between desire for Sabina and devotion to the ever-faithful Tereza. Adapted from the novel by Milan Kundera, the film stars Daniel Day-Lewis, Juliette Binoche and Lena Olin.

results.title: Tootsie
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Dick Richards and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Nobody will hire the rash Michael Dorsey (Dustin Hoffman) because he has antagonised every producer in New York. When his girlfriend fails an audition for a soap opera; Michael dresses up as “Dorothy Michaels” and lands the part. Michael’s sole conspirators are his agent George and his room mate Geoff. All goes well until “Dorothy” falls in love with beautiful co-star Julie (Jessica Lange) - and Julie’s father falls for “Dorothy.” Co-starring Bill Murray, Teri Garr, Charles Durning and Sydney Pollack.
